Comments.Message: Try again, this should fixed.

Well it does not :-)

But it might not be something with the repository function. I reported a addon problem earlier today with /rawr import and now when I try to load the char that I just saved rawr hands when loading.

Is it my char that is the problem or is it my rawr installation? I'll attach my save file for you to try.

Did you edit this xml file by hand by any chance?

The negative numbers in the available items list are using a long dash symbol instead of the usual minus and that is causing parsing errors. What is your locale set to?
No, not at all. I am running it on a IMac with OSX 10.6.7 if that got something to do with it?
That could also explain why I rawr hangs when reading the save file from disk?
A new version was posted, check if this resolves your issue.

Hi. Still got the same problem (I think...) with the repository:

I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily.

== Version: 4.1.6.0 ==

== These are the Steps that I have tried ==
Steps to reproduce the problem.
1. Imported from battle.net
2. Added raid buffs, some options and selected a boss.
3. Save to Rawr4 repository
Can you try saving a new xml with the new version? I want to see if the issue with minus signs is fixed and the repository thing is unrelated.

Yes of course!

Now I just started rawr, did import from addon on the start screen and the save as char. This is the result.

This time I could open the saved file (that have not worked before) but save to repository still gives the same error.

I have worked some with XML before and in my eyes it looks like a platform issue. Can it have something to do with that I'm on a mac and not a pc?

Ok the minus issue is indeed solved and I was able to open the character xml and save it to repository.

The way communication happens is that Rawr creates the character xml and sends it to the server in a html POST message. So there must be something interrupting this connection in your case or some crash on server side caused by unexpected data causing failure to reply.

Do the other server commands work for you such as loading character from battle.net?

Loading char from battle.net works great!

Is it possible to try to load a char from repository?

Try loading the following from repository: EU KulTiras Evilacroo test2

So if the other server operations seem to work it would seem the problem is specific to saving. I can't do testing on a mac so this might be a bit of a trouble to pin down. The best I think will be to try to find a way to interecept the http POST message being sent to the server. I know of programs for PC that do this, but I'm not sure for macs. I'll see if I can find something that would do the job.

Loading worked like a charm.

Ok. Let me know if you figure something out. I'll also have a look around and see if I can figure out how to listen to the trafic...

Here's some tools that could do the job: http://superuser.com/questions/42813/looking-for-http-debugging-proxy-for-mac-similar-to-fiddler-on-windows

Only do this if you're comfortable with computers and you're confident you won't break it.
Hmm... I used wireshark to capture a save to repository request I hop this can be of some use.

I've attached how the post message looks like when sending from my machine. What bothers me is a large number of garbled characters in your version. I'm not sure if that is something that is specific to the program that you used to intercept the message of if the message itself is such.

How did you save that capture? It looks like you probably saved it at some protocol level below HTTP. I've just tried this with Wireshark and here's how I got a clean capture of the post packet.

I started the capture as normal (using http filter so it's easier to find the packet we want). Locate the packet in the list. It will look something like this:

27	4.314858	172.16.33.24	65.98.8.131	HTTP	2171	POST /~EU%20KulTiras%20Evilacroo%20test2~ HTTP/1.1 

Then in the area below you'll see several protocol layers associated with the message:

Frame 27: 2171 bytes on wire (17368 bits), 2171 bytes captured (17368 bits)
Ethernet II, Src: Intel_e5:80:d1 (00:19:d1:e5:80:d1), Dst: Cisco_11:3a:80 (00:23:5e:11:3a:80)
Internet Protocol Version 4, Src: 172.16.33.24 (172.16.33.24), Dst: 65.98.8.131 (65.98.8.131)
Transmission Control Protocol, Src Port: 51140 (51140), Dst Port: http (80), Seq: 33609, Ack: 1, Len: 2117
7 Reassembled TCP Segments (35725 bytes): #15(488), #16(1380), #18(4140), #20(5520), #23(13800), #25(8280), #27(2117)
Hypertext Transfer Protocol

You want to click on the very last one, that is Hypertext Transfer Protocol.

Right click (or the alternative on mac to get context menu) and select Export Selected Packet Bytes...

And save that to a txt file and post here.
No need to redo the capture, I was able to reproduce the error. It happens due to the header Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded. I'll see if I can find a solution.
I think I fixed the problem. Let me know if it works for you now.
Yay!! It looks like it works now! Great work :-)
